title: HTML Headings
gp1: HTML headings are titles or subtitles that you want to display on a webpage.
gp2: HTML headings are defined with the <h1> to <h6> tags.
gp3: <h1> defines the most important heading. <h6> defines the least important heading.
gp4: Users often skim a page by its headings. It is important to use headings to show the document structure.
gp5: <h1> headings should be used for main headings, followed by <h2> headings, then the less important <h3>, and so on.
gp6: Each HTML heading has a default size. However, you can specify the size for any heading with the style attribute, using the CSS font-size property:
wp1: Search engines use the headings to index the structure and content of your web pages.
wp2: Note: Browsers automatically add some white space (a margin) before and after a heading.
wp3: Note: Use HTML headings for headings only. Don't use headings to make text BIG or bold.
wp4: W3Schools' tag reference contains additional information about these tags and their attributes.
wp5: For a complete list of all available HTML tags, visit our HTML Tag Reference.
